In [[August]] [[2006]], Google signed a [[United States Dollar|$]]900 million deal with [[News Corporation|News Corp.'s]] Fox Interactive Media unit to provide search and advertising on [[MySpace]] and other News Corp. websites including IGN, AmericanIdol.com, Fox.com, and Rotten Tomatoes, although Fox Sports is not included as a deal already exists between News Corp. and MSN.<ref>Staff Writer. [[August 8]], [[2006]].</ref>
In [[August]] [[2006]], Google signed a [[United States Dollar|$]]900 million deal with [[News Corporation|News Corp.'s]] Fox Interactive Media unit to provide search and advertising on [[MySpace]] and other News Corp. websites including IGN, AmericanIdol.com, Fox.com, and Rotten Tomatoes, although Fox Sports is not included as a deal already exists between News Corp. and MSN.<ref>Staff Writer. "[http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/business/5254642.stm Google signs $900m News Corp deal]." ''[[BBC News]].'' [[August 7]], [[2006]]. == Environment ==
  +
Google announced in October of 2006 that it plans to install thousands of [[solar panel]]s to provide energy for electricity, with expected benefits for both the environment and the company's finances. [http://www.marketwatch.com/News/Story/Story.aspx?dist=newsfinder&siteid=mktw&guid=%7B630082C7-5370-46C2-8041-FC3FCA28CA16%7D]
